cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 45 mi (75 km) SE of Port O'Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest toward the central Texas coast, then forecast to slow, turn north on Tuesday, and arc northeast along the upper Texas coast toward Louisiana through mid-week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast between Port O'Connor and Freeport, near Matagorda Bay

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning (plus Storm Surge Warning)
weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from Baffin Bay to Port Aransas, TX
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Port Aransas, TX to Morgan City, LA; Storm Surge Warning from Port Aransas, TX to Sabine Pass, TX including Galveston Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and upper Texas coast and southwestern Louisiana coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–50 mph) possible in the Houston/Galveston Bay area beginning Monday afternoon, peaking Tuesday as the center drifts nearby; gusts to 45 mph already observed offshore.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of inundation possible in Galveston Bay and the lower Houston Ship Channel during high tide, with large breaking waves along exposed coastlines.
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches with isolated totals up to 15 inches likely, leading to flash and urban flooding around the port and low-lying terminal facilities.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes within rainbands; prolonged heavy rain and high water could cause road closures and hamper cargo movement.
